title: phone screen went blank - would not respond to anything including hard reset
content:
Out of the blue whilst sat on my work desk i noticed the screen was completely off. This raised concern as it wasnt on power saver mode and had been charged that morning.

It did not respond to any of the remediations - recharge with orig cable/long press of power button. Completely unresponsive.

I had arranged to take it to the phone shop, but i was about to go on holiday. Anyway i had a my old S8 to use.

When I got back from holiday after a week it tried charging it and hey presto it worked again.

This phenomenon happened with a sony android tablet - the 'hard' reset would not work and you had to wait a week for it to discharge. 

Now, there might be a harder reset Im not aware of - otherwise it renders the phone unreliable if it has to be left for several days after a major crash.

Is this a known problem? is there some way of fixing the phone so this wont happen again? Is there a harder reset?

Thanks
Andy
